intro: Keithia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy keithia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Keithia pilosa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
